: I must get my memory back. I can't just give up like this. I could pretend to have amnesia, hide my identity and stay, waiting for the right moment to act.

question: #question#How can William Jacobs consistently hold onto his thoughts?

content.content: In life, there is nothing that absolutely must be done. I could just find a way to muddle through.
I could tell the police everything, help them solve the case, and eventually they could tell me what happened, helping me to get my memory back.
Surviving is hard enough, why make it difficult for myself?

dialog.content: Will Jacob successfully escaped from the hospital and went into hiding in a nearby small town. Occasionally, he studies Jonathan’s notebook but has never found a way to restore his memory.

This wasn't a good choice. Early the next morning, without explanation, the police handcuffed you and arrested you on charges of 'kidnapping and participating in human experiments,' throwing you into jail.

After Will Jacob was sent to prison, he gradually faded from memory, and soon there was no sign of the guards in the prison. However, one day, the sound of a monster's footsteps echoed through the prison, and all the inmates became the monster's feast.

The man in front of you seems a bit unhinged, his words disjointed and nonsensical, muttering things like 'god,' 'devotion,' and 'sacrifice' while gesticulating wildly. You find yourself confused and chilled to the bone.

The man pays little attention to Will Jacob; instead, he immolates himself as if offering himself as a sacrifice to some terrible malevolent spirit. Ensnared by the man's incantations, Will Jacob, after witnessing the man's self-immolation, picks up his gun and pulls the trigger at his temple.

(Leans in and presses his ear against the door, but it's completely silent inside. Suddenly, in the extreme silence, a faint, indistinct singing echoes, neither male nor female, incredibly mournful, engulfing him in endless despair and sorrow. It seems as if everything around him ceases to exist; all he wants is to give in completely.)
Will Jacob is entranced by the song, opens the door voluntarily and walks in. He climbs onto the massive contraption holding the monsters, only to be swarmed by the awakening creatures.

You must stop this terrifying system. If you can shut down the entire surveillance system, it will be much safer. It's obvious that this place has been abandoned. You must find a way to locate the main control room and shut down the system.
Alright, I'm leaving right now. (stands up and walks out)

profile.name: Guard
profile.public profile: Attacked by beasts, on the brink of death, knows the protagonist, hopes for the protagonist to save him
profile.goal: Hopes the protagonist will save him

dialog.content: (reaches out to grab Wil's pant leg) Wil... Wil... please, save me...
What! Who! What is this! (looks down to find the guard, sees a large chunk of flesh missing from his neck, seemingly bitten) Who are you? You know me?
Wil, Wil, save me... Did you succeed? Has our Lord descended... save me, I don't want to die, let the Lord look at me once more...
(realizes the guard is hallucinating but decides to seize the opportunity to ask for needed information) Do you know where the main control room is?
(slowly raises his hand) Over there... in that direction.
Who released those monsters to attack you?
(shuts his eyes tightly, unresponsive)
He's beyond saving, let him go. You can choose to help him as much as possible, or leave apologetically.

content.content: (He must be in a lot of pain. He surely doesn't want to die in such misery here; I am his last hope.) I will help him as much as I can, so he can pass away with dignity.

question: #question# How should Wil Jacobs act to demonstrate his perspective-taking ability and empathize with the guard's situation?

content.content: Everyone has to die at some point; try to come to terms with it.
Did you do something bad in your life to end up like this?
Don't be sad, think of your parents and grandparents. When you die, you can reunite with them in heaven.

Although my first reaction to seeing a seriously injured person is to stay and assist or get them to a hospital, his injuries are too severe for me to help. Besides, this place is so dangerous, those beasts might come after me at any moment. I can’t waste time here. I'm powerless to help; it's best to leave.

question: #question# How should Wil Jacobs act to demonstrate his ability to consciously control impulses?

content.content: Ahhh, my savior complex is kicking in, I need a cold shower to calm down.
(Takes a deep breath, talking to himself) Think it over, don’t act rashly, consider everything first.
I am really tempted to stay and save him, after all, a life is at stake! As for those beasts, they might not come so quickly. Let's take a gamble!

dialog.content: Go on, there's a blanket over there. Take it and cover the guard, then give him some water to drink.
(Does as the system instructs, softly saying to the guard) You can go peacefully now.
Leave now. Put on this hat, and wrap some strips of cloth around your wounds.
